1.title: Elephant in the Bedroom
1.plot: The family's extraordinary adventure gets off to a rocky start when guests arrive early.

2.title: Crocodile in a Crisis
2.plot: The team help a wounded crocodile, confront a bull elephant and search for a young child lost in the bush.

3.title: Elephant SOS
3.plot: As a rogue flash flood hits camp, Saba races to protect the camp and the animals.

4.title: Baby Elephant Rescue
4.plot: Saba and the elephant rescue team race to save the life of a recently orphaned elephant calf.

5.title: Problems in Paradise
5.plot: The camp reopens after the rainy season but Saba's worst nightmare is becoming a reality.

6.title: The Great Lion Hunt
6.plot: Saba is on a mission to find newborn lion cubs and Frank races to rescue a lioness.

7.title: Chaos in the Camp
7.plot: Saba's guests are accidentally stranded at a remote airstrip in the scorching African sun.

8.title: The River Crossing
8.plot: Drought is beginning to make life difficult for both people and wildlife.

9.title: Monkeys in the Kitchen
9.plot: Monkeys are taking over the family's safari camp. Frank and David help a bull elephant.

10.title: Elephant Baby Boom
10.plot: The team gear up to celebrate the end of the tourist season Samburu style.

imdb.plot outline: From the BBC website "Wildlife expert Saba Douglas-Hamilton, together with her husband Frank and their three young children, move to the romantic Samburu National Reserve in Kenya to run a safari camp for the first time. Born in Kenya with lions, giraffes and warthogs in her back garden, and speaking Swahili as her first language, Saba became entranced with wildlife at an early age. Her childhood was spent bumping around in the back of an open truck between Tanzania, Kenya and Uganda while her parents studied elephant behaviour and then battled to save them from the illegal ivory trade." She met husband Frank Pope at a wedding in the UK and they eventually married and have three young daughters. "After a couple of years with both of them flying round the world to be with each other, Frank finally took the plunge and moved to Kenya where he now works as the chief operations officer for Save The Elephants."
imdb.title: This Wild Life
plot: From the BBC website "Wildlife expert Saba Douglas-Hamilton, together with her husband Frank and their three young children, move to the romantic Samburu National Reserve in Kenya to run a safari camp for the first time. Born in Kenya with lions, giraffes and warthogs in her back garden, and speaking Swahili as her first language, Saba became entranced with wildlife at an early age. Her childhood was spent bumping around in the back of an open truck between Tanzania, Kenya and Uganda while her parents studied elephant behaviour and then battled to save them from the illegal ivory trade." She met husband Frank Pope at a wedding in the UK and they eventually married and have three young daughters. "After a couple of years with both of them flying round the world to be with each other, Frank finally took the plunge and moved to Kenya where he now works as the chief operations officer for Save The Elephants."

While Frank will be busy with the team at Save The Elephants, Saba will be running the luxury game lodge started by her mother, Elephant Watch Camp. The series tracks the adventures, trials and tribulations of the family and their neighbours, the Samburu people, as they come to terms with the realities of living among wild animals deep in the African bush. Many of the Samburu work for the camp, Save The Elephants or for other organisations in the area.::Brian Bakker

Saba Douglas-Hamilton (Big Cat Diaries) takes her husband Frank Pope and three young children to live in the place where she grew up: Samburu National Reserve in northern Kenya. Simultaneously, Frank takes over as CEO of Save The Elephants.::Brian Bakker
